oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Isospin effects in N~Z nuclei in extended Density Functional Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Satula, Wojciech
Nazarewicz, Witold
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nuclear Theory
Nuclear Experiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper overviews various phenomena related to the concept of isospin symmetry. The focus is on N~Z nuclei, which are excellent laboratories of isospin physics. The theoretical framework applied is nuclear Density Functional Theory and its isospin- and angular-momentum projected extensions, as well as symmetry-projected multi-reference models. The topics covered include: isospin impurities, superallowed beta decays, beta-transitions in mirror nuclei, isospin breaking hadronic interactions, mirror and triplet binding energy differences, and isoscalar pairing.
Comment: submitted to Physica Scripta to the Focus Issue on Nuclear Structure: Celberating the 75 Nobel Prize
